intro: Terniola pedunculosa, commonly known as the clustered sea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Indo-Pacific. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in saline environments and is often found growing in sandy or rocky coastal areas. Terniola pedunculosa plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for small marine organisms.
